#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=I think that if Beck had never started the legal action , this meme would have died out after a couple of weeks .
#Text=It might have popped up in the occasional place , but I do n't think it would have lasted the more than two months it has .
#Text=By super meme , I just mean that there are so many memes out there .
#Text=Some are specific to a certain site ; some have a very short life and die quickly ; some continue at a very low level .
#Text=This meme , however , just took off .
#Text=So many people were posting it on some many unrelated threads on Fark that moderators were banning people for it ) .
#Text=I 've seen people post this meme in places where few memes go - on news sites , blogs : anywhere people comment , this meme will pop up .

#Text=( ( WN ) ) You also wrote in your letter to Beck , " In this context of this WIPO case , you denigrated the letter of First Amendment law . " How would you like Beck to act differently in the future with regard to the First Amendment to the United States Constitution ?

column1: #Text=E-H : Beck 's WIPO complaint revolves around trademark issues .
#Text=His claim is that the domains violate the trademark he has in his name .
#Text=I do n't believe that was his ultimate motivation in trying to get the domain ; I think he was trying to stifle free speech .

#Text=I think he looked at Hustler v. Falwell and decided he could n't win against my legally-protected right to mock him , but that he might be able to use other means to get my point of view shut down . ( It 's easy to come to this conclusion if you look at the legal documents I posted on gb1990.net/legal - and I posted everything I got )
#Text=What I 'd like Beck to do differently is simply realize that the chilling effects of trying to have speech you disagree with shutdown would ultimately affect his rights as well .
#Text=I disagree with many of the things he says , and hope to put pressure on him to change his techniques ; but ultimately , I would never wish to stifle his first amendment rights .
#Text=There 's a difference between disagreeing with someone , mocking them , and trying to intimidate them to stop talking .
#Text=As regards the application of the Hustler v. Falwell case to this case , I think the overall application was fair : Parody and satire are protected forms of free speech . — Eiland-Hall

#Text=( ( WN ) ) In the final decision in the Beck v. Eiland-Hall case , the WIPO arbitrator cited the U.S. Supreme Court case , Hustler Magazine v. Falwell . Are you familiar with this Supreme Court case ? What are your thoughts on how it was applied to your case ?
#Text=E-H :
#Text=I am familiar with the case ; and in fact , it helped me sleep at night during the past couple of months .
#Text=I think it is a very important case on the topic of first amendment rights as regards parody and satire .
#Text=I strongly believe that humour should be used to point out the ridiculous - that 's one of the reasons that the Daily Show is so popular and successful .
#Text=They do it very well .
